'''H. O. Hartley''' (1912 â€“ 1980), born '''Herman Otto Hirschfeld''' but commonly called HOH,<ref>[http://www.amstat.org/about/statisticiansinhistory/bios/hartleyho.pdf ASA article by William B. Smith]</ref> was a [[Germans|German]]-[[United States|American]] [[statistician]]. He developed [[Hartley's test]] for equality of variances (published in 1950). In 1967 he and [[J.N.K. Rao]] published a [[maximum likelihood]] method for finding [[variance component]]s in [[mixed model]]s.  He made significant contributions in mathematical programming, optimization, and survey sampling.

He also founded [[Texas A&M University]]'s Department of Statistics.
